speaker: Amir
text: Hey, I just received an invitation to speak at the next developer summit.
ipa: heɪ | aɪ ʤəst rɪˈsivd ən ˌɪnvɪˈteɪʃən tə spiːk æt ðə nɛkst dɪˈvɛləpər ˈsʌmɪt
stress: HEY | I just RECEIVED an INVITATION to SPEAK at the NEXT DEVELOPER SUMMIT
linking:
"received an" → /rɪˈsivd ən/ (d links to ə)
"invitation to" → /ˌɪnvɪˈteɪʃən tə/ (n links to t)

speaker: Tessa
text: No way, that’s awesome! That’s a huge opportunity for someone leading our AI projects.
ipa: noʊ weɪ | ðæts ˈɔsəm | ðæts ə hjuʤ ˌɑpərˈtunəti fɔr ˈsʌmwʌn ˈlidiŋ aʊər eɪ aɪ ˈprɑʤɛkts
stress: NO WAY | that's AWESOME | that's a HUGE OPPORTUNITY for SOMEONE LEADING our AI PROJECTS
linking:
"that's a" → /ðæts ə/ (s links to ə)
"opportunity for" → /ˌɑpərˈtunəti fɔr/ (i links to f)

speaker: Amir
text: Exactly. They want a session focused on practical use cases.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli | ðeɪ wɑnt ə ˈsɛʃən ˈfoʊkəst ɑn ˈpræktɪkəl jus ˈkeɪsəz
stress: EXACTLY | they WANT a SESSION FOCUSED on PRACTICAL USE CASES
linking:
"want a" → /wɑnt ə/ (t links to ə)
"focused on" → /ˈfoʊkəst ɑn/ (d links to ɑ)

speaker: Tessa
text: You could present a project developed by our team last quarter. It’s super relevant.
ipa: ju kʊd prɪˈzɛnt ə ˈprɑʤɛkt dɪˈvɛləpt baɪ aʊər tim læst ˈkwɔrtər | ɪts ˈsupər ˈrɛləvənt
stress: YOU could PRESENT a PROJECT DEVELOPED by our TEAM last QUARTER | it's SUPER RELEVANT
linking:
"could present" → /kʊd prɪˈzɛnt/ (d links to p)
"developed by" → /dɪˈvɛləpt baɪ/ (d links to b)

speaker: Amir
text: True. I’m planning to include a section showing real-time ML predictions, so it feels more interactive.
ipa: tru | aɪm ˈplænɪŋ tu ɪnˈklud ə ˈsɛkʃən ˈʃoʊɪŋ ˈriəl taɪm ɛm ɛl prɪˈdɪkʃənz | soʊ ɪt filz mɔr ˌɪntəˈræktɪv
stress: TRUE | I'm PLANNING to INCLUDE a SECTION SHOWING REAL-TIME ML PREDICTIONS | so it FEELS more INTERACTIVE
linking:
"planning to" → /ˈplænɪŋ tu/ (g links to t)
"showing real-time" → /ˈʃoʊɪŋ ˈriəl taɪm/ (g links to r)

speaker: Tessa
text: Nice. And what about the demo involving the anomaly detection system? That caught a lot of attention last time.
ipa: naɪs | ænd wʌt əˈbaʊt ðə ˈdɛmoʊ ɪnˈvɑlvɪŋ ði əˈnɑməli dɪˈtɛkʃən ˈsɪstəm | ðæt kɔt ə lɑt əv əˈtɛnʃən læst taɪm
stress: NICE | and WHAT about the DEMO INVOLVING the ANOMALY DETECTION SYSTEM | that CAUGHT a LOT of ATTENTION last TIME
linking:
"what about" → /wʌt əˈbaʊt/ (t links to ə)
"demo involving" → /ˈdɛmoʊ ɪnˈvɑlvɪŋ/ (o links to i)

speaker: Amir
text: Yeah, good call. I’ll prep a version adapted for live presentation.
ipa: jæ | ɡʊd kɔl | aɪl prɛp ə ˈvɜrʒən əˈdæptɪd fɔr laɪv ˌprɛzənˈteɪʃən
stress: YEAH | GOOD CALL | I'll PREP a VERSION ADAPTED for LIVE PRESENTATION
linking:
"prep a" → /prɛp ə/ (p links to ə)
"version adapted" → /ˈvɜrʒən əˈdæptɪd/ (n links to a)

speaker: Tessa
text: Let me know if you need a diagram explaining the model’s training loop. I already have one sketched.
ipa: lɛt mi noʊ ɪf ju nid ə ˈdaɪəˌɡræm ɪkˈspleɪnɪŋ ðə ˈmɑdəlz ˈtreɪnɪŋ lup | aɪ ɔlˈrɛdi hæv wʌn skɛʧt
stress: LET me KNOW if you NEED a DIAGRAM EXPLAINING the MODEL'S TRAINING LOOP | I ALREADY HAVE one SKETCHED
linking:
"need a" → /nid ə/ (d links to ə)
"diagram explaining" → /ˈdaɪəˌɡræm ɪkˈspleɪnɪŋ/ (m links to e)

speaker: Amir
text: That’d be great. Also, I might need a volunteer to assist with the Q&A.
ipa: ðæd bi ɡreɪt | ˈɔlsoʊ | aɪ maɪt nid ə ˌvɑlənˈtɪr tu əˈsɪst wɪð ðə ˌkju ənd eɪ
stress: THAT'D be GREAT | ALSO | I MIGHT NEED a VOLUNTEER to ASSIST with the Q&A
linking:
"need a" → /nid ə/ (d links to ə)
"volunteer to" → /ˌvɑlənˈtɪr tu/ (r links to t)

speaker: Tessa
text: You’ve got a team willing to support you. Just ask!
ipa: juv ɡɑt ə tim ˈwɪlɪŋ tu səˈpɔrt ju | ʤəst æsk
stress: YOU'VE GOT a TEAM WILLING to SUPPORT YOU | JUST ASK
linking:
"got a" → /ɡɑt ə/ (t links to ə)
"willing to" → /ˈwɪlɪŋ tu/ (g links to t)
